name: DJ Screw
description:
'''Robert Earl Davis Jr.''' (July 20, 1971 – November 16, 2000), better known by his stage name '''DJ Screw''', was an American [[hip hop music|hip hop]] [[Disc jockey|DJ]] based in [[Houston, Texas]], and best known as the creator of the [[chopped and screwed]] DJ technique. He was a central and influential figure in the Houston hip hop community and was the leader of Houston's [[Screwed Up Click]].

Davis released over 350 mixtapes and was recognized as an innovator mostly on a regional level until his death from [[codeine]] overdose in 2000. His legacy was discovered by a wider audience around 2005, and has gone on to influence a wide variety of artists.
